Adding required columns and values#

Now, we will check for further required columns and values.

>>> my_dwca.generate_data_report()

Archive Report
---------------------
Pass/Fail: Fail
Data Type: Occurrence
Errors:
	- There are some invalid taxa according to the backbone you are comparing against.
	- You are missing required columns in your data.
Missing Columns Occurrence:
	family
	class
	kingdom
	order
	genus
	phylum
	geodeticDatum
	coordinateUncertaintyInMeters
	basisOfRecord
	occurrenceID OR catalogNumber OR recordNumber

Occurrence Report
---------------------
Coordinates Report:
	Data has coordinate fields?: True
	Invalid latitude count: 0
	Invalid longitude count: 0
Datetime Report:
	Has invalid datetime: False
	Number of invalid datetimes: 0
Taxonomy Report:
	Invalid taxon present: True
	Valid Taxon count: 0
	Unrecognised taxa:

                          original name                      proposed match(es) rank of proposed match(es)                          scientificName     rank                   species       genus     family     order         classs      phylum  kingdom
0               Eucalyptus sclerophylla                     Eucalyptus racemosa                    SPECIES                     Eucalyptus racemosa     None       Eucalyptus racemosa  Eucalyptus  Myrtaceae  Myrtales           None  Charophyta  Plantae
1  Eucalyptus camaldulensis var. obtusa  Eucalyptus camaldulensis subsp. obtusa                 SUBSPECIES  Eucalyptus camaldulensis subsp. obtusa     None  Eucalyptus camaldulensis  Eucalyptus  Myrtaceae  Myrtales           None  Charophyta  Plantae
2                       Acacia murayana                        Acacia murrayana                    species                        Acacia murrayana  species          Acacia murrayana      Acacia   Fabaceae   Fabales  Equisetopsida  Charophyta  Plantae

Column counts:
	scientificName: 35
	decimalLatitude: 35
	decimalLongitude: 35
	eventDate: 35

Sometimes you will need to add certain information to be able to submit data to an atlas. For the ALA, we require not only taxon information (scientificName, etc), latitude and longitude (decimalLatitude and decimalLongitude) as well as the date on which the species was spotted (eventDate), we will also require other fields:

  • coordinateUncertaintyInMeters: this is the uncertainty associated with any occurrence record. This can be something like the error associated with your GPS or phone. A good default, if you’re unsure, is 100.

  • geodeticDatum: this refers to the Coordinate Reference System (CRS) of how you recorded your data. For example, if you used your GPS, your CRS would likely be something called WSG84, which is the standard CRS for many GPSs.

  • basisOfRecord: this is how the record was taken. For example, if you observed all of these occurrences, then you would set the value of basisOfRecord to HumanObservation.

  • occurrenceID / catalogNumber/ recordNumber: a unique value associated with this specific occurrence.

For coordinateUncertaintyInMeters, geodeticDatum and basisOfRecord, you can set one value for all your occurrences using pandas. If you need to set them individually, then manually adding a column is likely best.

To add these columns and default values to them:

>>> my_dwca.occurrences["coordinateUncertaintyInMeters"] = 100
>>> my_dwca.occurrences["geodeticDatum"] = "WGS84"
>>> my_dwca.occurrences["basisOfRecord"] = "HumanObservation"
>>> my_dwca.occurrences.head()

            scientificName  decimalLatitude  decimalLongitude   eventDate  coordinateUncertaintyInMeters geodeticDatum      basisOfRecord
0       Corymbia latifolia           -13.04            131.07  2022-03-29                            100         WGS84  HUMAN_OBSERVATION
1     Eucalyptus tectifica           -13.04            131.07  2022-09-13                            100         WGS84  HUMAN_OBSERVATION
2           Banksia aemula           -33.60            150.72  2022-08-15                            100         WGS84  HUMAN_OBSERVATION
3  Eucalyptus sclerophylla           -33.60            150.72  2022-06-16                            100         WGS84  HUMAN_OBSERVATION
4        Persoonia laurina           -33.60            150.72  2022-10-19                            100         WGS84  HUMAN_OBSERVATION

For adding an occurrenceID / catalogNumber/ recordNumber, this is a bit different. Each occurrence has to have a different unique ID. We have written a function that will do this automatically, with you only having to specify the column name you wish to use.

>>> my_dwca.add_unique_occurrence_IDs(column_name="occurrenceID")
>>> my_dwca.occurrences.head()

                           occurrenceID           scientificName  decimalLatitude  decimalLongitude   eventDate  coordinateUncertaintyInMeters geodeticDatum      basisOfRecord
0  c5294492-6f74-454b-b478-0c8292bf298e       Corymbia latifolia           -13.04            131.07  2022-03-29                            100         WGS84  HUMAN_OBSERVATION
1  c91081bd-3c54-4c27-b513-85b36acdbe8d     Eucalyptus tectifica           -13.04            131.07  2022-09-13                            100         WGS84  HUMAN_OBSERVATION
2  93b44aaf-ae11-4629-b5e0-15f309b53236           Banksia aemula           -33.60            150.72  2022-08-15                            100         WGS84  HUMAN_OBSERVATION
3  a478aaa8-67d2-4975-8c6b-efeafa8cdf03  Eucalyptus sclerophylla           -33.60            150.72  2022-06-16                            100         WGS84  HUMAN_OBSERVATION
4  96597dc1-fe7f-45c0-a0cc-e29efdbe90b0        Persoonia laurina           -33.60            150.72  2022-10-19                            100         WGS84  HUMAN_OBSERVATION

For more ways to prepare your data, go back to the “Preparing Data” main page.
